page.title: 03A PRIVATE ESTATE
page.content: {Perrystone Court}is the home of {Brigadier Clive, a descendant of Clive {of India. }He has lived there{all his {life,}and his{family}have been there {since 1850. }The estate of{2500 acres is run by his son; {1000 acres are let {as 3 farms. }There are{3 gamekeepers, {2 foresters,}and{7 other workers}on the estate. {100 years ago}there were {13 gardeners,}besides all the other workers. All the staff have been there for many years, one of them for 40. One did leave early -{"The {Prince of Wales pinched a gardener {from me." }Brigadier Clive hopes the estate will{stay in his family}and has already{handed it to his son. }He is very keen on{forestry;}2/3 of the trees are{hardwoods,}1/3{softwoods. The keepers raise{pheasant}for {shooting parties from Belgium; 500 {birds a day for 7 guns is normal.
